wlc.name: ETCBC BSHA
wlc.description: The data that powers qBible is the ETCBC4 (Eep Talstra Centre for Bible and Computing) linguistic database (formerly known as WIVU). The data was generated by a partnership between the German Bible Society and the Netherlands Bible society and is archived for open access. QBible itself is open source. Another way of interacting with the same data is to use SHEBANQ which provides a way of building and saving queries to the data.

net.name: NET

license.name: NET Bible® copyright ©1996-2016 by Biblical Studies Press, L.L.C.  All rights reserved.

net.description: The LXX data is derived from work especially by CCAT using the work of Michael Stead in Bible Crawler who also provided the base for some work on the SDBH (Semantic Dictionary of Biblical Hebrew) (still needing a lot of revision).

lxx.name: LXX
lxx.description:
Septuaginta, ed. A. Rahlfs
(Stuttgart: Württembergische Bibelanstalt, 1935; repr. in 9th ed., 1971).

CATSS LXX = The computer form prepared by the TLG (Thesaurus Linguae Graecae) Project directed by T. Brunner at the University of California, Irvine, with further verification and adaptation (in process) by CATSS towards conformity with the individual Göttingen editions that have appeared since 1935.
